Package com.android

Interface Behaviour<T,​U,​V,​R>

Type Parameters:
T - type T for our functional interface can be any type of object
U - type U for our functional interface can be any type of object
V - type V for our functional interface can be any type of object
R - type R for our functional interface can be any type of object
Functional Interface:
This is a functional interface and can therefore be used as the assignment target for a lambda expression or method reference.
@FunctionalInterface
public interface Behaviour<T,​U,​V,​R>
we create our own functional interface, which is an interface with only one abstract and has four generic types. this is used in Examples.ex2() method to show a lambda that will implement this functional interface
Author:
NoelF
See Also:
Examples.ex2()

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    default double cheer​(T t, Integer num)
    to show you can have many default methods
    static String crowd​(String str, Integer num, Integer num2)
    you can have many static methods in a functional interface, however you CANNOT use any of the generics used in the abstract method, as those generics are tied to an INSTANCE of a class and statics apply to the class rather than an object of the class (a static method can have its' own generics though)
    R happy​(T t, U u, V v)
    lambdas ONLY care about abstract methods and there can only be ONE so when we create a lambda for this functional interface, we are implmenting THIS method.
    default int riot​(T t, U u)
    you can have as many default methods as you want and you can use the generics, but you lambda will ONLY CONTAIN IMPLEMENTATION FOR the abstract method and not any of the default methods, a anonymous class can contain implementation for default methods

  • Method Details

    • happy

      R happy​(T t, U u, V v)
      lambdas ONLY care about abstract methods and there can only be ONE so when we create a lambda for this functional interface, we are implmenting THIS method. So a lambda for this has to define four types (can be all the same type or all different) and has to return a value of type R and take in values of type T, U and V i.e Happy<String,Integer,Double,String>myHappy defines a T as a String, U as a Integer, V as a String and R as a String
      Parameters:
      t - variable of type T and type defined when creating a lambda for this interface
      u - variable of type U and type defined when creating a lambda for this interface
      v - variable of type V and type defined when creating a lambda for this interface
      Returns:
      returns a value of type R that will be defined when creating a lambda for htis interface

    • crowd

      static String crowd​(String str, Integer num, Integer num2)
      you can have many static methods in a functional interface, however you CANNOT use any of the generics used in the abstract method, as those generics are tied to an INSTANCE of a class and statics apply to the class rather than an object of the class (a static method can have its' own generics though)
      Parameters:
      str - just a random string
      num - just a random numbers
      num2 - just a random number
      Returns:
      reurns a String

    • riot

      default int riot​(T t, U u)
      you can have as many default methods as you want and you can use the generics, but you lambda will ONLY CONTAIN IMPLEMENTATION FOR the abstract method and not any of the default methods, a anonymous class can contain implementation for default methods
      Parameters:
      t - is a variable defined when creating a object that implements this interface
      u - is a variable defined when creating a object that implements this interface
      Returns:
      just a ramdom number that is returned

    • cheer

      default double cheer​(T t, Integer num)
      to show you can have many default methods
      Parameters:
      t - paramter ot type T
      num - simple Integer variable
      Returns:
      just returning any value for illustration purposes
